title: Trigger Object
content: Configure the split-button attribute. You can use the built-in button to trigger the drop-down menu. In addition, you can use the type attribute to configure the button status. The usage is the same as that of the Button component

title: Display Arrow
content: You can set visible-arrow to true to display the arrow. By default, the arrow is not displayed.

title: Custom Text
content: Dropdown can use the title attribute to customize the display text

title: Menu hiding mode
content:
The

drop-down menu is hidden by default after a menu item is clicked. You can disable this function by setting hide-on-click to false.

title: Disabled
content:
The

Dropdown and DropdownItem components can be disabled through the disabled attribute.

title: Different Sizes
content: Additional sizes: medium, small, mini, configured by setting the size property.

title: Use Profile
content:
DropdownYou can configure the attributes of DropdownMenu through the menu-options attribute. titleConfigure the name of the trigger source

DropdownMenu You can configure the attributes of DropdownItem through the options attribute. text-field is used together with options to specify the fields displayed in the menu copywriting. text-field The default value is label

title: Multi-Level Menu
content: Dropdown can set the subnodes of a menu through the children field

title: The minimum width of the dialog box is the same as that of the trigger source.
content: Dropdown can use the inherit-width attribute to configure the minimum width of DropdownMenu to inherit the width of the trigger source

title: Internal Event
content: The built-in events include the button-click, item-click, and visible-change events.

title: Default slot
content: Dropdown can be customized through the default slot
